cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast tonight, then move near or over the South Carolina coast on Thursday and accelerate northeast along the North Carolina coast Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central South Carolina coast (close to the Charleston–Myrtle Beach corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Savannah River to the North Carolina/Virginia border, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds (Hurricane Warning) and Savannah River to Isle of Palms SC in Storm-Surge Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from Flagler/Volusia County FL through coastal South Carolina and North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (sustained near 105-110 mph with higher gusts) possible Thursday; tropical-storm-force winds beginning tonight
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft inundation possible in and around Charleston Harbor, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 15 inches possible, producing flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and isolated tornadoes along the coastal plain
